When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:


```{r}
density2 <- ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=Sepal.Width, fill=Species))
density2 <- density2 + geom_density(stat="density", alpha=I(0.2)) +
  xlab("Sepal Width") +  ylab("Density") + ggtitle("Histogram & Density Curve of Sepal Width")
```

```{r}
regression <- ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=Sepal.Length, y=Sepal.Width, color=Species)) + 
  geom_point(aes(shape=Species), size=1.5) + xlab("Sepal Length") + ylab("Sepal Width") + 
  ggtitle("Scatterplot with smoothers") + geom_smooth(method="lm")
```

## using cowplot putting two figures togather
```{r}
density2
regression
```

```{r}
# install.packages("cowplot")
library(cowplot)

plot_grid(density2, regression)
```
